perfunctory: Done superficially, without much care, or merely as routine
peripatetic: Journeying from place to place; traveling on foot
perennial: Lasting through the years or indefinitely, enduring; recurring
peregrinate: Travel from place to place, esp. on foot
perspicacious: Having penetrating insight or good discernment
philistine: Person deficient in or hostile to culture
phalanx: Formation of soldiers carrying shields close together for defense; any very close group of people
